419640.name: Sculpting and Rendering a Cthulhu Bust
419640.description:
In this tutorial, we'll create a Cthulhu bust in ZBrush starting from a sphere. We'll use features like Dynamesh, Curve Brush and Transpose Master. I'll show you every step of the process from designing in 3D, blocking out forms to adding realistic micro-detail. Learn how to use Keyshot to light, shade and render your Cthulhu bust. Then using Photoshop, we'll composite our renders and add finishing touches to create the final render. This is a live video demonstration covering every step of the process.

This tutorial is catered towards ZBrush beginners. However, a basic knowledge of Zbrush is required. Average knowledge of Photoshop & Keyshot required.

Latest ZBrush UI configs available at

Chapters

  • Sculpting with ZBrush
  • Rendering with Keyshot and Photoshop

Files:

  • ZBrush UI config + Gravity Brush
  • Decimated ZTL file for reference.
  • Cthulhu OBJ files for Keyshot
  • Working PSD file
  • Final JPEG artwork
  • 1 Hi-Res skin texture
